runs.comm: streaky, but off the mark. That was on leg stump, and flicked airborne in the direction of square leg. Didn't go to hand though
brilliant delivery and that's a massive shout for caught-behind, lbw, call it what you will. It nipped off the pitch and flicked the top of the pad. A hint of inside edge? The umpire says no
he's gone this time, and that was another cracker - fuller, faster and angling back into the left-hander. No room to play any shot whatsoever, and up goes the finger!
just back of a length, straight as an arrow again. Sangakkara defends off the back foot and legs it for a single
fast and full again, nudged into the covers
width this time, and Sangakkara fences outside off stump - not much conviction in the stroke, but he threads it through the gap at gully, past a diving Clarke at point
swinging delivery, a foot outside off, and Tharanga leaves well alone
fuller and straighter, and defended into the covers. A brief thought of a single, but with three Aussies hurtling in to field, Sangakkara has other ideas
a slog, straight through the line of the ball and over the covers. Not perfectly timed and the ball plugs in the outfield
lovely response, nipping past a limp outside edge. Well pitched up, and a hint of movement off the track
that's a filthy mow - Tharanga makes room and is well beaten as the ball whistles over leg stump

that dismissal was somewhat telegraphed. He was dancing around at the crease and, in attempting to whip to leg, found only a leading edge. Brett Lee at deep point swallows a looping chance, and Sri Lanka are in deep trouble now
short of a length, and dabbed to square leg. Sri Lanka need to rebuild now
full and straight, and driven down to long-off
streaky again, full length and outside off, and Sangakkara is late on an attempted drive. He chinese-cuts it down to fine leg, and jogs through

oh dear, this is carnage. Jayawardene was in no position for that stroke - a wristy whip through midwicket that turned into a looping chance for Stuart Clark at mid-on. He did well to dive forward and scoop it off the turf, but a very loose shot from Sri Lanka's captain
driven back to the bowler, without much conviction
another cracking over for Australia is finished off with a neat offcutter that leaps at Silva's thigh-pad and drops to the crease
on a good length outside off stump and shaping away. Defended with a vertical bat
dropped - that was an easy chance that Hodge made into a tough opportunity with a mistimed leap at cover. Another careless shot though, Sangakkara was driving at a ball that wasn't there for the shot
dabbed out to cover, tip-and-run stuff, and a direct hit from Symonds would have had him gone for all money. Reckless stuff
a massive swipe across the line. Sri Lanka are losing their heads now
outside off, and a more sensible choice of stroke this time, a delicate dab down to third man
that's just horrible. Three steps down the track and an almighty slog over the infield. Except he doesn't make contact at all. Australia are bossing this contest
on leg stump and clipped fine. A welcome boundary
an attempted cut, but too late on the stroke
half an appeal as Johnson jags one off the seam but that was missing leg, and too high as well. Good ball all the same
not such a good ball. Pitches outside leg and stays that way
width outside off stump, but Silva misses out with a cut shot. Too eager to cash in?
fuller and shaping back into the right-hander, clipped off leg stump and a scurried single
shorter and straighter, tucked off the ribs but can't beat the field
immaculate line and length - it's just like watching the Ashes all over again - and Silva defends with a perfectly straight bat
more of the same, no room to free the arms

he frees his arms this time, but to absolutely no avail - a massive windmill of a wind-up, but a ball that was intended to vanish over the covers instead spirals down to Brett Lee on the third man boundary. Credit to Clark, he built the pressure and Silva cracked
width, and that's Sri Lanka's best shot of the day - a full-flowing cover-drive that no-one can intercept
straighter this time, and nudged for a single
on the spot again, with a touch of outswing as well. Dilshan leaves well alone
full and straight, turned into the leg side
clipped off the toes, but straight to midwicket
backing away - the batsman's curse in this tournament - and Johnson finds just enough swing to evade a slashing drive
straighter and fuller, and played with a vertical bat for a change
banged in, and balloons off the glove as Dilshan is beaten for pace. An attempted pull lands behind square, but safe
extra nip off the pitch, and Sangakkara's scything cut finds only thin air
steered out to deep point, and they hustle for a couple
short but straighter - crashed into the legs of point

that wasn't very clever. Dilshan tries to improvise, he steps outside off and tries to sweep off a good length, but instead pats a simple chance straight into Gilchrist's gloves as he hops to the leg-side. Another one bites the dust, and with the exception of Jayasuriya, they've all been tame dismissals
short and Mubarak ducks his first delivery
a rare error from Clark, he strays onto the pads and Mubarak tickles that very fine. A welcome boundary
back on a better line and length. It's survival first now for Sri Lanka
a touch leg-sided, clipped firmly but straight to backward square
straighter, and extra lift off the track. Defended into the leg side
on leg-stump again, and clipped again. Another single. They all count
good-looking drive off a fuller length. Very straight, but not perfectly timed as long-on sweeps round to intercept
strays onto leg stump again, but deep midwicket restricts the runs
driven up to long-on. Another over rolls by
straight and full, and tucked down to third man
thumped, and effectively so. A little shimmy down the pitch, and Clark - who had come off a short run - is made to pay
short but straight, Sangakkara tried to make room to free his arms but couldn't keep it down. His attempted cut was wafted straight to backward point, and Sri Lanka are in freefall now
good line, good length, Maharoof drives

good grief, another one falls. Too straight to take any liberties, but that's exactly what Maharoof did - he made to mow through the covers, but Michael Clarke at point pulls off a blinder, one-handed to his right, an inch off the ground!
defended. As well it might be
width outside off, cut into the ground off the back foot
a thick edge flies safely on the way to third man
low full delivery, driven out to mid-off
room outside off and a classical off-drive, so nice to see and double cheers because that brings up the fifty
hmm, not so good, the batsman misjudging outside off, fencing a prod off the back foot
width again outside off and scooped up towards deep point where Watson attempts to scoop up, misses, and allows an extra run which Sri Lanka gratefully accept
straight, and watched all the way on to the bat - good practice - for a froward defensive
shorter delivery and Vaas is surprised by it, so fails to capitalise fully in his timing of the pull
poked forward
a no-ball for overstepping, so here comes the free hit
slower delivery, straight and full - that'll be a yorker then - and driven tamely to mid-off
on middle-and-off, staying over to the left hander by the way, who defends solidly
another tidy delivery, full of superb line and equally good length
driven out to mid-off for an easy single
pushes him on the back foot and he waits patiently, before presenting a very straight bat in defence
good running - a quick single for one nibbled forward and the batsmen ste off immediately
slanted slightly across the left hander, with a touch of room outside off. The batsman jumps back and is quick to defend on the back foot
a full toss heading down off is driven out square on the off-side
same again, and this time it's cut to deep point
leg-side rubbish, a low full toss, helped on its way quickly through a fine fine leg
better - Bracken immediately back on it with a regulation line-and-length delivery
on a length again, but Mubarak is quick to rush the ball back out to mid-off with a smooth drive
driven out to cover
driven out to a deepish mid-off (not quite long-off)
driven forward for a strike-stealing single
driven forward for another quick single
no-ball on height reasons - therefore it's not a free hit
waits and driven out to cover
hit on the up, deliberately, towards third man
touch of width outside off, opens the face, and runs it down to deep third man (fourth man?)
outside off, cut to deep point
clever delivery, taking the pace off it and slants it across, threatening to deceive the left hander, who plays too close to his body to get bat on it
outside off, played down to third man
half-volley, driven back out straight towards long-off
tight line again, and a good length; can only be driven out to the fielder at cover
slower ball, picked, and driven out in front of midwicket for a comfortable single
a hint of swing away, the batsman waits and cuts through the gully
a touch of width outside off, driven out to mid-off and that rounds off another tidy spell
not the prettiest of slog-sweeps in front of square, but at least it was controlled

slower delivery, the offspinner and the pressure told on Mubarak, trying to clear extra cover with a drive off one knee but Symonds makes no mistake, stepping back and clasping to take Sri Lanka into further trouble
driven out to cover
bouncer from Watson, nearly falling over in the follow-through such was his effort
pitches on middle and angles towards leg, worked off the legs behind square
on leg, turned fine off the knees
the batsman likes the pace coming onto the bat; he presents the face and the ball runs out to mid-off
full delivery - Lee's done well with such deliveries this tournament - and it's dug out here
short, on leg - a long hop - and Vaas wrists the ball up and towards Hayden at deep square... but he can't quite meet it before it pitches
dribbled out to mid-on for a quick single
outside off, too full, Vaas drives it hard down the ground but doesn't quite time it and it's collected inside the straight long-off boundary
good sportsmanship from Symonds, running in at mid-on - he nearly got there to take the catch with the dive forward, but tells the umpire immediately that he did take it cleanly
a very tailender-like swish - no footwork, prodding away from the body at a rising delivery outside off
but this is much better - Malinga lifting a hook from outside off in front of midwicket
driven on the up between mid-off and cover
slower delivery - like a kipper, the batsman completely fails to connect
a big - but ultimately ineffectual - swing, Vaas down the track and picks out Lee at deep midwicket, five yards in from the rope, who does well stretching out to his right
comes forward and turns off his legs to bring up three figures
nothing to write home about, but as it must be written about, a full toss outside off greeted by an almighty - but completely mistimed - heave to mid-off which hardly makes it even there
poked forward

a poor shot - indicative of Sri Lanka's day - to finish. A slower ball from Bracken, and the batsman pops up a bottom edge back towards the bowler who has a second to think about before taking confidently
